content.text:
# List of wars involving Qatar

This is a list of wars involving the State of Qatar.
{|class="wikitable"
! style="background:#931638" width="170"|
! style="background:#931638" width="150"|
! style="background:#931638" width="150"|
! style="background:#931638" width="290"|
|-
|style="background:#efefef"| Saudi invasion of Qatar  (1793–1798)
|style="background:#efefef"|  Qatar Bahrain Oman Ottoman Empire
|style="background:#efefef"|  First Saudi State
|style="background:#FFD0D0"| Defeat
* Incorporation of Qatar into First Saudi State
|-
|Battle of Khakeekera(1811)
|
Bahrain   Sheikhdom of Kuwait
|
Diriyah
|style="background:#D0FFD0"|Bahraini victory
|-
|style="background:#efefef"| Qatari War of Independence(1867–1868)
|style="background:#efefef"|  Qatar
|style="background:#efefef"|  Bahrain Abu Dhabi (1867)
|style="background:#E0D0FF"| Ceasefire
*British intervention and signing of the Anglo-Bahraini Treaty of 1868
*British recognition of Al-Thani in Qatar
*Independence of Qatar from Bahrain
|-
|style="background:#efefef"| Qatari–Abu Dhabi War(1881–1893)
|style="background:#efefef"|  Qatar  Supported by:
|style="background:#efefef"|  Abu Dhabi  Supported by:
|style="background:#E0D0FF"| Inconclusive
*No territorial changes
*British-mediated peace agreement in 1893
|-
|style="background:#efefef"| Battle of Al Wajbah(1893)
|style="background:#efefef"|  Qatar
|style="background:#efefef"|
|style="background:#D0FFD0"| Qatari victory
* Relinquishment of Qatari captives
* Eventual independence of Qatar from the Ottoman Empire
|-
|style="background:#efefef"| Gulf War(1990–1991)
|style="background:#efefef"| Other Allies
|style="background:#efefef"|
|style="background:#D0FFD0"| Victory
* Iraqi withdrawal from Kuwait; Emir Jaber Al-Ahmad Al-Jaber Al-Sabah restored
* Heavy casualties and destruction of Iraqi and Kuwaiti infrastructure
|-
|style="background:#efefef"| Libyan Civil War(2011)
|style="background:#efefef"|  NTC
*
*
*
*
*
*
*
*
*
*
| style="background:#efefef" |
|style="background:#D0FFD0"| Victory
* Muammar Gaddafi was killed
* The NTC assumed interim control of Libya
* 102 countries, UN, EU, AL and AU diplomatically recognised the National Transitional Council as the sole governing authority for Libya
|-
|style="background:#efefef"| Intervention against ISIL(2014–present)
|style="background:#efefef"|  Free Syrian Army Syrian Kurdistan
|style="background:#efefef"|  Islamic State
---- Al-Qaeda
*  al-Nusra Front
*  Khorasan
---- Ahrar ash-Sham
|style="background:#E0D0FF"| Ongoing
* Unilateral US-Arab intervention against Syrian Islamists
|-
|style="background:#efefef"| Intervention in Yemen  (2015–2017)
|style="background:#efefef"|  Hadi government
|style="background:#efefef"|  Houthi government
*  Houthis
*  Saleh loyalists (until 2017)
|style="background:#E0D0FF"| Withdrawal
* Qatar expelled from the coalition due to the 2017 Qatar diplomatic crisis
|-
|}
